senses.de: An initial payment made when something is bought on credit.  The rest of the amount is usually paid in installments.
senses.ex: We made a 20% down payment on the house and took out a mortgage for the remaining amount.

Tips.title: Real Estate
Tips.description: A down payment is a crucial part of buying a home.  A larger down payment can lead to a lower interest rate and smaller monthly payments.
Tips.example: They saved for years to make a substantial down payment on their dream home.

Tips.title: Car Purchases
Tips.description: While a smaller down payment means lower upfront costs, it can result in higher monthly payments and more interest paid over the life of the loan.
Tips.example: She opted for a low down payment on her new car, but it meant higher monthly installments.

Deposit.wordDefinition: Similar to 'down payment,' often used interchangeably, especially in British English.  However, 'deposit' can refer to any partial upfront payment, not necessarily for a large purchase like a house or car.

Initial payment.wordDefinition: A more general term encompassing down payments but also including other types of upfront payments.
